title: Rotational Energy - change energy slipping on ramp

content.question: Which of the following graphs could represent <math alttext="E sub f" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>E</mi> <mi>f</mi> </msub> </math> as a function of <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mi>Î¼</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line segment in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled mu, and the vertical axis is labeled E sub f. The value E sub 0 is indicated near the top of the vertical axis. A dashed horizontal line extends from E sub 0. The line segment begins at the origin and slants upward and to the right until it ends at E sub 0, near the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line segment in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled mu, and the vertical axis is labeled E sub f. The value E sub 0 is indicated near the top of the vertical axis. The line segment begins on the vertical axis at E sub 0 and extends horizontally to the right until it ends above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line segment in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled mu, and the vertical axis is labeled E sub f. The value E sub 0 is indicated near the top of the vertical axis. A dashed horizontal line extends from E sub 0. The line segment begins on the vertical axis slightly above halfway between the horizontal axis and E sub 0. It moves horizontally to the right until it ends above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled mu, and the vertical axis is labeled E sub f. The value E sub 0 is indicated near the top of the vertical axis. A dashed horizontal line extends from E sub 0. The curve begins at E sub 0 on the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right until it reaches a minimum about halfway along the horizontal axis and halfway between the horizontal axis at E sub 0. It then moves upward and to the right until it ends at E sub 0, above the end of the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled mu, and the vertical axis is labeled E sub f. The value E sub 0 is indicated near the top of the vertical axis. A dashed horizontal line extends from E sub 0. The curve begins at E sub 0 on the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right until it reaches a minimum about halfway along the horizontal axis and halfway between the horizontal axis at E sub 0. It then moves upward and to the right until it ends at E sub 0, above the end of the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
